intro: Pothomorphe lessertiana, commonly known as the desert sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of North America. It is a member of the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming structure. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are typically succulent, adapted to store water in its harsh environment. Pothomorphe lessertiana thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in desert scrub and rocky habitats.
